data.enText: clung
clung

data.chText: 抓紧；紧握；紧抱
data.enText: to hold on tightly to sb/sth

data.chText: 紧紧抓住救生筏的幸存者
data.enText: survivors clinging to a raft

data.chText: 她紧紧抱住她的婴儿。
data.enText: She clung on to her baby.

data.chText: 紧紧抓住！
data.enText: Cling on tight!

data.chText: 他们紧紧地抱在一起，冷得直发抖。
data.enText: They clung together, shivering with cold.

data.chText: 粘住；附着
data.enText: to stick to sth

data.chText: 紧身连衣裙
data.enText: a dress that clings (= fits closely and shows the shape of your body)

data.chText: 湿衬衫紧贴在他的胸部。
data.enText: The wet shirt clung to his chest.

data.chText: 烟味仍附着在她的衣服上不散。
data.enText: The smell of smoke still clung to her clothes.

data.chText: （尤指情感上）依恋，依附
data.enText: to stay close to sb, especially because you need them emotionally

data.chText: 萨拉在母亲去世后比以往任何时候都更依附于她的姨妈。
data.enText: After her mother's death, Sara clung to her aunt more than ever.
cling to sth
cling on to sth

data.chText: 不愿放弃；坚持
data.enText: to be unwilling to get rid of sth, or stop doing sth

data.chText: 在整个审判中，她都坚持相信他是清白的。
data.enText: Throughout the trial she had clung to the belief that he was innocent.

data.chText: 他还抱着最后的一线希望。
data.enText: He had one last hope to cling on to.

data.chText: 她顽强地又活了几年。
data.enText: She managed to cling on to life for another couple of years.

data.text: hold ♦ hold on ♦ cling ♦ clutch ♦ grip ♦ grasp ♦ clasp ♦ hang on

data.chText: 以上各词均含抓住、抱住、托住、握住之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to have sb/sth in your hands, arms, etc.
hold

data.chText: 指抓住、抱住、托住、握住：
data.enText: to have sb/sth in your hand, arms, etc.

data.chText: 她提着一只大箱子。
data.enText: She was holding a large box.

data.chText: 我把婴儿轻轻地抱在怀里。
data.enText: I held the baby gently in my arms.
hold on (to sb/sth)

data.chText: 指抓紧、不放开：
data.enText: to continue to hold sb/sth; to put your hand on sb/sth and not take your hand away

data.chText: 握紧，我让你松手时再松开。
data.enText: Hold on and don't let go until I say so.
cling

data.chText: 尤指用身体紧抱、紧握、抓紧：
data.enText: to hold on to sb/sth tightly, especially with your whole body

data.chText: 生还者紧紧抱住一块块漂浮在水面上的残骸。
data.enText: Survivors clung to pieces of floating debris.
clutch

data.chText: 尤指用手抓紧、紧握、抱紧、突然抓住：
data.enText: to hold sb/sth tightly, especially in your hand; to take hold of sth suddenly

data.chText: 她站在那里，手里仍然紧握着花束。
data.enText: She stood there, the flowers still clutched in her hand.

data.chText: 他感到自己滑了一下，便一把抓住一根树枝。
data.enText: He felt himself slipping and clutched at a branch.
grip

data.chText: 指用手紧握、紧抓：
data.enText: to hold on to sth very tightly with your hand

data.chText: 尽可能紧紧抓住绳子。
data.enText: Grip the rope as tightly as you can.
grasp

data.chText: 指抓紧、抓牢：
data.enText: to take hold of sth firmly

data.chText: 他热情地抓着我的手握了起来。
data.enText: He grasped my hand and shook it warmly.

data.chText: grasp的宾语通常为hand或wrist。
data.enText: The object of grasp is often sb's hand or wrist .
clasp

data.chText: 指紧握、攥紧、抱紧：
data.enText: ( formal ) to hold sb/sth tightly in your hand or in your arms

data.chText: 他们相互紧握着对方的手。
data.enText: They clasped hands (= held each other's hands) .

data.chText: 她把孩子紧紧地搂在怀里。
data.enText: She clasped the children in her arms.

data.chText: clasp的宾语通常为hand或另一个人。
data.enText: The object of clasp is often your hands , sb else's hand or another person.
hang on (to sth)

data.chText: 尤指为支撑自己或防止跌倒紧紧抓住某物：
data.enText: to hold on to sth very tightly, especially in order to support yourself or stop yourself from falling

data.chText: 抓紧，我们出发了！
data.enText: Hang on tight. We're off!
to hold/clutch/grip/clasp sth in your hand/hands
to hold/catch/clasp sb/sth in your arms
to grip/grasp sth with your hand/hands
to hold/clutch/grip/grasp/clasp/hang on to sth
to hold/cling/hang on
to hold/clutch/clasp sb/sth to you
to hold/hold on to/cling to/clutch/grip/grasp/clasp/hang on to sb/sth tight/tightly/firmly
cling to sth
cling on to sth

data.chText: 不愿放弃；坚持
data.enText: to be unwilling to get rid of sth, or stop doing sth

data.chText: 在整个审判中，她都坚持相信他是清白的。
data.enText: Throughout the trial she had clung to the belief that he was innocent.

data.chText: 他还抱着最后的一线希望。
data.enText: He had one last hope to cling on to.

data.chText: 她顽强地又活了几年。
data.enText: She managed to cling on to life for another couple of years.

tr: fruit (especially peach) whose flesh adheres strongly to the pit

example: hang on to your father's hands
The child clung to his mother's apron

tr: come or be in close contact with
stick or hold together and resist separation
example: The dress clings to her body
The label stuck to the box

tr: to remain emotionally or intellectually attached
example: He clings to the idea that she might still love him.

value.def: If you cling to someone or something, you hold onto them tightly.

example.ex: Another man was rescued as he clung to the riverbank...
example.tran: 另外一个人因为紧紧攀住河堤而获救。

example.ex: She had to cling onto the door handle until the pain passed...
example.tran: 她只好紧紧握住门把手，直到不疼了才松开。

example.ex: They hugged each other, clinging together under the lights.
example.tran: 他们彼此拥抱，在灯光下紧紧相依。

value.def: If someone clings to a position or a possession they have, they do everything they can to keep it even though this may be very difficult.

example.ex: He appears determined to cling to power...
example.tran: 看来他决心要抓住权力不放。

example.ex: Another minister clung on with a majority of only 18...
example.tran: 另一位部长仅以18票的微弱优势保住了职位。

example.ex: Japan's productivity has overtaken America in some industries, but elsewhere the United States has clung on to its lead.
example.tran: 在有些行业，日本的生产效率超过了美国，但在其他行业美国仍然保持着领先的地位。

value.def: Clothes that cling to you stay pressed against your body when you move.

example.ex: His sodden trousers were clinging to his shins.
example.tran: 湿淋淋的裤子紧紧粘在他小腿上。

value.def: Something that is clinging to something else is stuck on it or just attached to it.

example.ex: Her glass had bits of orange clinging to the rim.
example.tran: 她的杯口上粘有些许橙汁。

value.def: If someone clings to a person they are fond of, they do not allow that person to be free or independent.

example.ex: I was terrified he would leave me, so I was clinging to him.
example.tran: 我害怕他会离开我，所以缠着他不放。

example.ex: She was anxious not to appear clinging.
example.tran: 她竭力不让自己看上去显得过分依恋别人。

value.def: If you cling to an idea or way of behaving, you continue to believe in its value or importance, even though it may no longer be valid or useful.

example.ex: They know scholars reject their legend, but they still cling to their belief...
example.tran: 尽管知道学者们不相信他们的传说，他们还是坚持自己的信仰。

value.tran: 墨守，坚持(观念或行为方式)

trans: (尤指包装食物的)透明薄膜，塑料保鲜膜
